newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares firm at mid-session.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares firm at mid-session.

text.p: Delhi shares remained steady at mid-session on Tuesday on selective buying by domestic and foreign institutional investors (FIIs), brokers said.
At 12.45 a.m. (0715 GMT), the bourse's benchmark index was upa marginal 0.10 point at 773.60.

"Bajaj Auto Ltd's stocks were in good demand among FIIs and domestic buyers," said Ram Prasad Sharma of Singal Associates. The company is expected to announce its financial results for 1996/97 (April-March) on Wedndesday.
Bajaj Auto Ltd rose 21 rupees to 864 on purchases by FIIs and traders.
State Bank of India added 0.50 rupees to 304.40.
Reliance Industries Ltd edged up 0.45 rupees to 293.70.
